messages.text: Hi! Considering Julia's AOT compilation, is using ccall(:clock, Int64, ()) before and after a function call a fair comparison with the same method in C for benchmarking?

text.text: Hi! Considering Julia's AOT compilation, is using ccall(:clock, Int64, ()) before and after a function call a fair comparison with the same method in C for benchmarking?

messages.text: arthurmaciel: do you want to include or exclude compile time?

text.text: arthurmaciel: do you want to include or exclude compile time?

messages.text: AnAverageHuman: I want to exclude compile time; consider just the performance of the function itself.

text.text: AnAverageHuman: I want to exclude compile time; consider just the performance of the function itself.

messages.text: arthurmaciel: are you aware of @benchmark / @btime from the BenchmarkTools package?

text.text: arthurmaciel: are you aware of @benchmark / @btime from the BenchmarkTools package?

messages.text: AnAverageHuman: thanks for pointing that out! Do youknow if they are implemented using C's clock_gettime with the monotonic clock flag? I am asking to reassure they will do justice to other languages benchmark tools :)

text.text: AnAverageHuman: thanks for pointing that out! Do youknow if they are implemented using C's clock_gettime with the monotonic clock flag? I am asking to reassure they will do justice to other languages benchmark tools :)

messages.text: arthurmaciel: i'm having a hard time parsing this file but my best guess is <https://github.com/JuliaCI/BenchmarkTools.jl/blob/master/src/execution.jl#L381> which calls time_ns(), which is defined as ccall(:jl_hrtime, UInt64, ()) which is defined as uv_hrtime()

text.text: arthurmaciel: i'm having a hard time parsing this file but my best guess is <https://github.com/JuliaCI/BenchmarkTools.jl/blob/master/src/execution.jl#L381> which calls time_ns(), which is defined as ccall(:jl_hrtime, UInt64, ()) which is defined as uv_hrtime()

messages.text: <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/blob/8d80154c9c0d2ec7b8e8d090c173c1b0d8ee495b/src/sys.c> which is defined as uv__hrtime() <https://github.com/libuv/libuv/search?q=uv__hrtime>

text.text: <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/blob/8d80154c9c0d2ec7b8e8d090c173c1b0d8ee495b/src/sys.c> which is defined as uv__hrtime() <https://github.com/libuv/libuv/search?q=uv__hrtime>
